page.title: 07Social Concerns-Risby
page.content: Residents were asked how the village had changed and most acknowledged that the expansion of the village had brought people of different backgrounds and outlook into the village, even to the extent that two populations now live side by side, those born in the village who still rely mainly on the land for their livelihood, and those who have moved in, in search of a rural lifestyle but who are still very much transplanted town dwellers. Some residents complain of loud mouthed youths, vandalism, litter and heavy lorries which are indications of some of the problems associated with urban living affecting this quiet country district. On the other hand villagers clearly rely heavily on the town for shopping etc. as transport was a concern which was often voiced.
